Adult (borealis).description: Red-tailed Hawks have broader wings and lack the large, dark patches at the wrist seen on Rough-legged Hawks. Red-tails usually show a band of dark streaks on the belly and dark patches between the shoulder and wrist (patagium).

Juvenile light morph (calurus/alascensis.description: Red-tailed Hawks have broader wings and thicker bodies than Rough-legged Hawks. Juvenile Red-tails have narrowly banded tails but lack the white tail base and dark tail tip of light-morph Rough-legged Hawks.

Adult female.description: Northern Harriers are more slender-bodied and have longer wings and tail than Rough-legged Hawks. They look more unsteady in flight, teetering with changing wind currents.

Immature.description: Northern Harriers are more slender than Rough-legged Hawks. All plumages lack the heavy dark body markings and dark wrist patches of Rough-legged Hawks.

Light morph.description: Ferruginous Hawks are larger-bodied than Rough-legged Hawks, with straight wings that taper toward the tips. They are paler below than Rough-legged Hawks, without the large, dark wrist patches, and without heavy markings on the breast or belly.

Dark morph.description: Dark-morph Ferruginous Hawks are best told from Rough-legged by shape: note the heavy body and broad wings that taper toward the tips.
